intro: Justicia jitotolana, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are borne in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
